bibl.title: Adolph Krug vs. The United States of America. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the APPLICATION OF ADOLPH KRUG FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RELEASE, and other proceedings thereon.
div1.p: TO THE HON. C.H. HANFORD, ONE OF THE JUDGES OF THE CIRCUIT COURT, AND THE OTHER JUDGES THEREOF.
Your Petitioner, Adolph Krug, most respectfully represents:

1.
That he is now and for more than five years last past has been bona fida a citizen of the United States and of the State of Washington, residing during the said time in the city of Seattle, in the County of King, and in the Northern Division of the District of Washington.

11.
That William H. Moyer is the duly acting Sheriff of King County, in which the City of Seattle is situated; all of which is in the Northern Division of the District of Washington.

111.
That your Petitioner as such citizen of the United States, is now being restrained of his liberty, and imprisoned by the said William H. Moyer, as such sheriff, unlawfully, and claims his right as a citizen of the United States, of release from

restrained and from imprisonment, but the said William H. Moyer denies and refuses to discharge and release this Petitioner, claiming to act by virtue of some alleged authority and under alleged proceedings, the nature of which more particularly is hereinafter set forth.

1V.
Your petitioner represents that he is so illegally restrained of his liberty and that he is unlawfully imprisoned by the said William H. Moyer at the City of Seattle, County of King; that he is being denied his liberty and is being unlawfully restrained and imprisoned contrary to his rights as a citizen of the United States and against the laws of the United States, and in violation of the laws of the United States, and contrary to the Constitution of the United States and against the Constitution of the United States providing and prescribing for him protection and immunity from such illegal and unlawful imprisonment and detention; all of which more fully appears by the specific allegations following, to-wit:

V.
Your petitioner represents that the cause of his alleged illegal and wrongful restraint as given by the said Moyer, acting for and in behalf of the State of Washington, as the sheriff of King County, is that on the 23rd day of October - 1893, your petitioner was indicted, and by indictment exhibited in the County of King, before the Superior Court of King County, was charged with a crime, which alleged indictment assuming to charge a crime against your petitioner is in words and figures following, to-wit:
